metadata.source: Manual compilation from dc.gov and agency websites
metadata.notes: Comprehensive database of DC permits, licenses, and certifications that the public can apply for

agencies.name: Department of Buildings
agencies.formerly: DCRA (Department of Consumer and Regulatory Affairs)

agencies.name: Department of Licensing and Consumer Protection
Fire and Emergency Medical Services Department
Office of Planning / Historic Preservation Office
Homeland Security and Emergency Management Agency
Office of Cable Television, Film, Music and Entertainment

permits.name: Residential Building Permit (1-2 Family)
permits.description: Required for construction, additions, major alterations, and renovations to one- and two-family residential properties. Covers structural work, layout changes, and major home improvements.
permits.how_to_apply: Use the DOB Permit Wizard online application for residential 1-2 family projects.
permits.requirements: Construction documents, proof of ownership or authorization, contractor license (if applicable), may require DCRA plan review.
permits.fees: Varies by project scope; see DOB fee schedule
permits.processing_time: Varies; Accelerated Plan Review (APR) available for qualifying projects

permits.name: Commercial Building Permit
permits.description: Required for commercial construction, tenant fit-outs, and renovations to commercial properties. Includes new developments, additions, and major alterations.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through the Citizen Access Portal for commercial projects.
permits.requirements: Detailed construction documents, engineering plans, zoning compliance review, may need multi-agency review.
permits.fees: Varies by project scope and square footage

permits.name: Electrical Permit
permits.description: Required for electrical installations, modifications, or repairs beyond simple fixture replacements. A trade/specialty permit.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DOB Citizen Access Portal as a supplemental/trade permit.
permits.requirements: Licensed electrician required, electrical plans for major work.
permits.processing_time: Typically faster than full building permits

permits.name: Plumbing Permit
permits.description: Required for plumbing installations, modifications, or new connections. A trade/specialty permit.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DOB Citizen Access Portal.
permits.requirements: Licensed plumber required.
permits.processing_time: Typically faster than full building permits

permits.name: Mechanical/HVAC Permit
permits.description: Required for heating, ventilation, air conditioning, and gas installations or modifications. A trade/specialty permit.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DOB Citizen Access Portal.
permits.requirements: Licensed mechanical contractor required.
permits.processing_time: Typically faster than full building permits

permits.name: Solar Panel Permit
permits.description: Required for installation of solar panels on residential or commercial properties.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DOB Citizen Access Portal. Streamlined process available for standard residential solar.
permits.requirements: System design plans, structural analysis, electrical diagrams.
permits.fees: Reduced fees for residential solar installations
permits.processing_time: Expedited review available for standard residential solar

permits.name: Demolition/Raze Permit
permits.description: Required to demolish or raze an existing structure. Subject to additional review if in a historic district.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DOB Citizen Access Portal. Historic properties require additional HPO review.
permits.requirements: Raze application, environmental assessment (asbestos/lead), utility disconnection documentation.

permits.name: Certificate of Occupancy (C of O)
permits.description: Certifies that a building or structure is safe to inhabit and complies with zoning regulations, DC construction codes, and the Green Building Act. Required before occupying a new or significantly altered building.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply after construction is complete and all inspections pass.
permits.requirements: Final building inspection approval, fire inspection, zoning compliance.

permits.name: Pop-Up Permit (PUP)
permits.description: Streamlined Certificate of Occupancy for temporary use of a previously vacant building for up to one year, without going through the traditional permitting process.
permits.how_to_apply: Contact DOB for PUP application process.
permits.requirements: Building must be previously vacant, temporary use plan.
permits.fees: Reduced compared to standard C of O

permits.name: After-Hours Construction Permit
permits.description: Required for construction work outside of normal permitted hours (typically before 7am or after 7pm on weekdays, and weekends/holidays).
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DOB Citizen Access Portal.
permits.requirements: Valid building permit, justification for after-hours work.
permits.fees: Additional fee on top of standard building permit

permits.name: Antenna/Satellite Dish Permit
permits.description: Required for installation of telecommunications antennas or satellite dishes on buildings.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DOB Citizen Access Portal.
permits.requirements: Structural analysis, RF emissions compliance.

permits.name: Boiler Permit
permits.description: Required for installation or replacement of boilers in buildings.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DOB Citizen Access Portal as a specialty permit.
permits.requirements: Licensed contractor, equipment specifications.

permits.name: Elevator Permit
permits.description: Required for installation, modification, or major repair of elevators, escalators, and similar conveyances.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DOB Citizen Access Portal as a specialty permit.
permits.requirements: Licensed elevator contractor, engineering plans.

permits.name: Fence Permit
permits.description: Required for installation of fences. Fences in public space also require a DDOT public space permit.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DOB for private property; DDOT TOPS for public space.
permits.requirements: Site plan showing fence location and height.

permits.name: Retaining Wall Permit
permits.description: Required for construction of retaining walls over 4 feet from bottom of footing to top of wall.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DOB; public space walls also need DDOT permit.
permits.requirements: Engineering plans for walls over 4 feet, site plan.

permits.name: Public Space Occupancy Permit
permits.description: Required for any use or occupancy of public space including sidewalks, alleys, roadways, and curb lanes. Covers dumpsters, construction staging, scaffolding, and temporary structures.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply online through DDOT's Transportation Online Permitting System (TOPS).
permits.requirements: TOPS account, site plan, liability insurance. All submissions must be electronic.
permits.fees: Varies by type and duration; surface permits issued for 30 days

permits.name: Public Space Excavation Permit
permits.description: Required for any excavation work in public space, including utility connections, pipe repairs, and underground work.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply online through TOPS.
permits.requirements: TOPS account, excavation plans, utility mark-out (Miss Utility).
permits.fees: Varies; excavation permits issued for 45 days

permits.name: Sidewalk Cafe Permit
permits.description: Required for restaurants to operate outdoor dining on public sidewalk space. Also requires a Certificate of Use (COU) from DOB.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through TOPS for public space rental, plus DOB for Certificate of Use.
permits.requirements: Active DDOT public space rental account, site plan showing table layout, ADA compliance, DOB COU application.
permits.fees: Annual public space rental fee varies by location

permits.name: Driveway/Curb Cut Permit
permits.description: Required for installing or modifying driveways and curb cuts in public space.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through TOPS.
permits.requirements: Site plan, engineering drawings.

permits.name: Tree Removal/Pruning Permit
permits.description: Required for planting, pruning, or removing any tree in the public right of way. Must obtain permission from DDOT Urban Forestry Division.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through TOPS with Urban Forestry Division approval.
permits.requirements: Arborist assessment may be needed, justification for removal.
permits.fees: Varies; tree replacement fee may apply for removals

permits.name: Banner/Sign Permit (Public Space)
permits.description: Required for installing banners, signs, or seasonal displays on DDOT street light poles or other public infrastructure.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through TOPS.
permits.requirements: Design specifications, location details, duration.

permits.name: Valet Parking Permit
permits.description: Required for businesses providing valet parking using public curb space. Available as Event Venue Valet (occasional) or Standard Valet (regular) permit.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through TOPS.
permits.requirements: Business license, insurance, designated parking area plan.

permits.name: Electric Wiring in Public Space Permit
permits.description: Required for installing electric wiring or conduit in public space.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through TOPS.
permits.requirements: Electrical plans, licensed contractor.

permits.name: Vault Permit
permits.description: Required for installation of a vault (underground structure) beneath public space.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through TOPS.
permits.requirements: Structural engineering plans, site survey.

permits.name: Oversized/Overweight Vehicle Permit
permits.description: Required to operate oversized or overweight vehicles on DC streets. Available as annual tags or single haul permits.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through TOPS.
permits.requirements: Vehicle specifications, route plan.

permits.name: Shared Micromobility Fleet Permit
permits.description: Required for companies operating shared scooter or bike fleets in DC. Issued for annual terms (e.g., 2025-2026 cycle).
permits.how_to_apply: Apply during open application period on DDOT shared mobility portal.
permits.requirements: Fleet management plan, insurance, compliance with DC regulations.

permits.name: Neighborhood Block Party Permit
permits.description: Required for temporary street closures for neighborhood block parties.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through HSEMA for street closure, coordinate with DDOT.
permits.requirements: Community notification, street closure plan, filed at least 15 business days in advance.

permits.name: Special Event Permit (Structures)
permits.description: Required for special events that include tents, stages, bleachers, generators, or other temporary structures.
permits.how_to_apply: Submit tent/structure application through DOB Citizen Access Portal.
permits.requirements: Tent application, site plan, fire safety plan, structural details.
permits.fees: Varies by structure type and size
permits.processing_time: Submit well in advance of event

permits.name: Parade Permit
permits.description: Required for organizing parades in DC (excluding First Amendment activities). Must not substantially interrupt traffic.
permits.how_to_apply: File completed application with MPD at least 15 business days before the event.
permits.requirements: Application, route plan, crowd management plan. Must go through MSETG if street closures needed.

permits.name: Assembly Plan Notification
permits.description: Required notification for planned assemblies and demonstrations in DC. First Amendment activities are managed by MPD.
permits.how_to_apply: Submit notification to MPD.
permits.requirements: Event details, expected attendance, location.

permits.name: Special Event Street Closure Permit
permits.description: Required for temporary street closures for special events. Must be approved by the Mayor's Special Events Task Group (MSETG).
permits.how_to_apply: Submit Street Closing Information Form to HSEMA. Present event proposal to MSETG (meets 2nd and 4th Monday of each month).
permits.requirements: Street closure plan, event proposal, MSETG presentation and concurrence.
permits.fees: Varies; Special Event Relief Fund may cover some costs
permits.processing_time: Must present to MSETG well before event date

permits.name: Film Permit
permits.description: Required for commercial film, television, and photography production on public property in DC.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DC Film Office.
permits.requirements: Production details, location plan, insurance, may need additional public space permits.

permits.name: Park Permit / Reservation
permits.description: Required for reserving DC parks, recreation centers, athletic fields, and picnic areas for events or activities.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DPR permits and reservations system.
permits.requirements: Event details, expected attendance, setup needs.
permits.fees: Varies by facility and event type

permits.name: Fire Code Operational Permit
permits.description: Required for activities regulated by the DC Fire Code including storage of hazardous materials, use of open flames, pyrotechnics, and other fire safety-related operations.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through FEMS Fire Prevention Division.
permits.requirements: Fire safety plan, inspection may be required.

permits.name: Fireworks Permit
permits.description: Required for the display of fireworks in DC. Consumer fireworks are generally prohibited; permit is for professional displays.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through FEMS. Professional pyrotechnician required.
permits.requirements: Licensed pyrotechnician, safety plan, site plan, insurance.

permits.name: Special Event Fire Safety Permit
permits.description: Required for events with significant occupancy loads. Organizers must notify the Office of the Fire Marshal at least 5 business days before the event.
permits.how_to_apply: Submit event notification to Fire Marshal via email or online portal.
permits.requirements: Site plan with exits and dimensions, anticipated occupancy, $150 application fee.
permits.fees: $150 (covers plan review, approval, and onsite inspection)

permits.name: Basic Business License (BBL)
permits.description: Required for operating any business in DC. The BBL is the foundational license for all commercial activity in the District.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply online through DLCP. Certificate of Clean Hands required.
permits.requirements: Certificate of Occupancy for business location, Clean Hands certificate, EIN, Articles of Incorporation (if applicable).
permits.fees: Varies by business category; biennial renewal

permits.name: Short-Term Rental License
permits.description: Required for hosting guests via Airbnb, VRBO, or other short-term rental platforms. Property must be owner's primary residence.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DLCP. Must be primary residence with Homestead Tax Deduction eligibility.
permits.requirements: Homestead Deduction documentation, Clean Hands certificate, $250K liability insurance, FR-500 tax registration, HOA permission if applicable.
permits.notes: Host must be present for STR (no limit on stays/year); Vacation Rental allows up to 90 nights/year without host present.

permits.name: Vending License
permits.description: Required for street vending operations in DC, including food carts, merchandise vendors, and mobile businesses.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DLCP by appointment only.
permits.requirements: BBL, health permits (for food), vending site assignment.

permits.name: Home Occupation Permit
permits.description: Required for operating a business from your home. The Zoning Administrator reviews HOP applications for compliance with DC Zoning Regulations.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DOB Zoning Administrator.
permits.requirements: BBL, proof of residence, description of home business activity.

permits.name: Food Service Establishment License
permits.description: Primary operating permit for restaurants, cafes, and food service establishments. Required before serving food to the public.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply online through DC Health Food Division portal. No paper applications accepted.
permits.requirements: Kitchen plan review and approval, health inspection, Certified Food Protection Manager on staff, food handler permits for all employees.
permits.processing_time: Varies; plan review must be completed before construction

permits.name: Food Handler's Permit
permits.description: Required for all employees who handle food in a food service establishment.
permits.how_to_apply: Complete approved food safety training and apply through DC Health.
permits.requirements: Completion of approved food safety training course.

permits.name: Certified Food Protection Manager Certificate
permits.description: At least one manager at every food establishment must hold this certification. Must be a certified food protection manager present during all hours of operation.
permits.how_to_apply: Pass an approved exam (e.g., ServSafe) and obtain DOH-issued Manager ID Card.
permits.requirements: Pass approved food safety exam (ServSafe or equivalent), DOH Manager ID Card.
permits.fees: ~$150 for exam; DOH card fee additional

permits.name: Mobile Food Vending License (Food Truck)
permits.description: Required for operating a food truck or mobile food unit in DC. Requires both health and business licensing.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DC Health for health permit, plus DLCP for vending license.
permits.requirements: Vehicle health inspection, commissary agreement, food handler permits, vending license.

permits.name: Temporary Food Event Permit
permits.description: Required for temporary food service at festivals, farmers markets, and special events.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DC Health Food Division.
permits.requirements: Event details, food safety plan, temporary setup meeting health standards.
permits.processing_time: Apply well in advance of event

permits.name: On-Premises Alcohol License (Restaurant/Tavern/Nightclub)
permits.description: Required for establishments serving alcohol for on-premises consumption. Types include Restaurant, Tavern, Nightclub, Hotel, Club, and Multipurpose. Class C (spirits, wine, beer) or Class D (wine and beer only).
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through ABCA. Attend Alcohol Licensing 101 course recommended for new applicants.
permits.requirements: BBL, Certificate of Occupancy, clean criminal record, community notification (ANC), compliance with placement restrictions.
permits.fees: Application fee plus annual license fee ($100+)
permits.processing_time: 60-120 days typical; requires public notice period

permits.name: Off-Premises Alcohol License (Retail/Liquor Store)
permits.description: Required for selling sealed alcoholic beverages for off-premises consumption (liquor stores, grocery stores, convenience stores).
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through ABCA.
permits.requirements: BBL, Certificate of Occupancy, clean criminal record, community notification.
permits.fees: Application fee plus annual license fee

permits.name: Internet Alcohol Retailer License
permits.description: For retailers selling alcohol online without a physical location open to the public. Class A (spirits, beer, wine) or Class B (beer and wine only).
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through ABCA.
permits.requirements: BBL, delivery compliance plan, age verification procedures.

permits.name: Manufacturer's Alcohol License
permits.description: Required for breweries, wineries, and distilleries. Includes Class A (over 500 barrels/year), Class B (under 500 barrels), and Class C (baked goods with up to 5% ABV).
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through ABCA.
permits.requirements: Federal TTB permit, BBL, production facility compliance.

permits.name: Festival Alcohol License
permits.description: Temporary license permitting sale and consumption of alcohol at approved events for up to 15 days. Can apply every 3 months.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through ABCA for specific event dates.
permits.requirements: Event details, site plan, security plan.

permits.name: Third-Party Alcohol Delivery License
permits.description: Permits same-day delivery of alcohol to consumers by delivery companies on behalf of licensed retailers and manufacturers.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through ABCA.
permits.requirements: Delivery compliance plan, age verification at delivery, insurance.

permits.name: Commercial Lifestyle Alcohol License
permits.description: Permits on-premises alcohol consumption in common areas of mixed-use commercial developments (walkways, plazas, outdoor areas) purchased from licensed tenants.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through ABCA.
permits.requirements: Mixed-use development, predefined boundary plan, licensed tenant partners.

permits.name: Medical Cannabis Retailer License
permits.description: Permits dispensing medical cannabis and products to eligible patients and caregivers. Also permits manufacturing, purchasing, and selling paraphernalia.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply during open application periods through ABCA (online, in-person, or email). Conditional license available without a location.
permits.requirements: 21+ years old, DC incorporated for-profit corporation, current on tax filings, not owing DC more than $100, no testing lab interest.
permits.fees: $8,000 standard; $2,000 for social equity applicants (first 3 years)
permits.processing_time: Varies; applications only accepted during open periods

permits.name: Medical Cannabis Cultivation Center License
permits.description: Permits growing cannabis for sale to licensed retailers. No licensee may hold more than 2 cultivation center licenses.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply during open application periods through ABCA.
permits.requirements: Same as retailer; plus cultivation facility compliance, security plan.

permits.name: Medical Cannabis Manufacturer License
permits.description: Permits processing, packaging, and labeling of medical cannabis products for sale to licensed retailers and internet retailers.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply during open application periods through ABCA.
permits.requirements: Manufacturing facility compliance, product testing requirements.

permits.name: Medical Cannabis Internet Retailer License
permits.description: Permits online sale and delivery of cannabis to eligible patients without a physical storefront open to the public.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply during open application periods through ABCA.
permits.requirements: Delivery compliance, age/patient verification, DC incorporation.

permits.name: Medical Cannabis Testing Laboratory License
permits.description: Permits testing of medical cannabis products for safety and potency. Applications accepted on an ongoing basis.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply anytime through ABCA (ongoing acceptance).
permits.requirements: Laboratory accreditation, qualified personnel, equipment standards.

permits.name: Medical Cannabis Courier License
permits.description: Permits delivery of medical cannabis from licensed retailers to patients.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through ABCA.
permits.requirements: DC incorporation, delivery compliance, patient verification.

permits.name: Erosion and Sediment Control (ESC) Plan Approval
permits.description: Required for any land-disturbing activity affecting more than 50 square feet. Prevents erosion and sediment pollution in DC waterways.
permits.how_to_apply: Submit through DOEE's Surface and Groundwater System (SGS) and DOB's ProjectDox.
permits.requirements: ESC plan showing existing topography, proposed changes, control measures, and implementation schedule.

permits.name: Stormwater Management Plan (SWMP) Approval
permits.description: Required for projects disturbing 5,000+ square feet of land. Must demonstrate stormwater retention (1.2 inches for major projects, 0.8 inches for substantial improvements).
permits.how_to_apply: Submit through DOEE alongside ESC plan.
permits.requirements: Stormwater management design, retention calculations, compliance options (on-site, off-site, in-lieu fee, or SRC purchase).

permits.name: Green Area Ratio (GAR) Plan Approval
permits.description: Required for new development and renovation projects zoned other than R1-R4. Ensures adequate green/environmental elements in development.
permits.how_to_apply: Submit GAR plan through DOEE as part of building permit process.
permits.requirements: Landscape plan meeting minimum GAR score for zoning district.

permits.name: Asbestos Abatement Permit
permits.description: Required for removal of asbestos-containing materials. Must be obtained by licensed abatement contractors.
permits.how_to_apply: Submit online through DOEE Asbestos ePermitting System.
permits.requirements: Licensed abatement contractor, BBL, Clean Hands certificate, asbestos survey, 10 working day advance notification, building occupant notification 30 days prior.
permits.processing_time: Minimum 10 working days advance notification required

permits.name: Lead Renovation/Abatement Permit
permits.description: Required for renovations or lead-based paint abatements in buildings built before 1978. Individuals and firms must be DOEE-certified.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DOEE Lead & Healthy Housing Division.
permits.requirements: DOEE certification for lead work, EPA RRP Rule compliance for residential/child-occupied facilities.

permits.name: Underground Storage Tank (UST) Permit
permits.description: Required for installation, operation, and removal of underground storage tanks containing petroleum products.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DOEE UST/LUST Branch.
permits.requirements: Tank specifications, installation plans, monitoring plan, financial assurance.

permits.name: Air Quality Permit
permits.description: Required for new and existing sources of air pollution. The Permitting Branch reviews applications to ensure compliance with air quality standards.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DOEE Air Quality Division.
permits.requirements: Emission calculations, equipment specifications, compliance demonstration.

permits.name: Fishing License
permits.description: Required for recreational fishing in DC waters.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DOEE.
permits.requirements: Valid ID, age requirements.

permits.name: Historic Preservation Review (Building Permit for Historic Property)
permits.description: Required when a building permit involves work affecting the exterior of a historic property or designated interior. Not a separate application â€” it's an additional review step in the normal building permit process. Over 95% are handled through expedited HPO staff review.
permits.how_to_apply: File building permit as normal; HPO reviews automatically. Contact HPO first for preliminary consultation. Email: historic.preservation@dc.gov
permits.requirements: Building permit application, photos of existing conditions, proposed design drawings. May need HPRB review for major projects.
permits.fees: No additional fee beyond building permit
permits.processing_time: Most handled through expedited HPO review; HPRB meets monthly (except August)

permits.name: HPRB Concept Review
permits.description: Optional early-stage review by the Historic Preservation Review Board for major projects on historic properties. Allows design feedback before investing in detailed construction documents.
permits.how_to_apply: Email completed application form and materials to historic.preservation@dc.gov by filing deadline.
permits.requirements: Concept drawings, project description. Contact HPO staff before filing.
permits.processing_time: Scheduled at next available HPRB meeting (monthly)

permits.name: Zoning Variance
permits.description: Allows a property owner to deviate from strict zoning requirements when strict application would cause exceptional practical difficulties or undue hardship. Heard by the Board of Zoning Adjustment (BZA).
permits.how_to_apply: Complete BZA Form-135 with architect or DC-barred attorney. File with Office of Zoning.
permits.requirements: Demonstration of exceptional hardship, no substantial detriment to public good, consistency with zoning intent. ANC notification required.

permits.name: Special Exception
permits.description: Permission to use property in a way that is allowed by the Zoning Regulations but requires BZA approval due to potential impacts on neighbors.
permits.how_to_apply: File application with BZA through Office of Zoning.
permits.requirements: Meets specific criteria in Zoning Regulations, ANC notification.

permits.name: Barber License
permits.description: Required for practicing barbering in DC. Types include Operator, Manager, Owner, and Instructor. Expires September 30th of odd-numbered years.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DLCP occupational licensing portal. Access DC account required.
permits.requirements: Exam completion, training hours, 6 CE credits for renewal (2 health/safety + 4 general).

permits.name: Cosmetology License
permits.description: Required for practicing cosmetology, esthetics, braiding, electrolysis, or manicuring in DC. Types include Operator, Manager, Owner, and Instructor. Expires April 15th of even-numbered years.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DLCP occupational licensing portal.
permits.requirements: Exam completion, training hours, 6 CE credits for renewal.

permits.name: Body Art License (Tattoo/Piercing/Micropigmentation)
permits.description: Required for tattoo artists, body piercers, and micropigmentation practitioners. Types include Operator and Manager.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DLCP.
permits.requirements: Training, bloodborne pathogens certification.

permits.name: Architect License
permits.description: Required for practicing architecture in DC. Overseen by the Board of Architecture, Interior Design & Landscape Architects.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DLCP.
permits.requirements: NCARB certification, exam passage, education requirements.

permits.name: Professional Engineer License
permits.description: Required for practicing professional engineering in DC.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DLCP Professional Engineer Board.
permits.requirements: PE exam, education, experience requirements.

permits.name: Real Estate License
permits.description: Required for real estate agents, brokers, and property managers in DC. Overseen by the Real Estate Commission.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DLCP.
permits.requirements: Pre-license education, exam, background check.

permits.name: Real Estate Appraiser License
permits.description: Required for performing real estate appraisals in DC.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DLCP.
permits.requirements: Appraisal education, exam, supervised experience.

permits.name: Security Guard License
permits.description: Required for security officers and security agencies operating in DC.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DLCP Security program.
permits.requirements: Training, background check.

permits.name: Tour Guide License
permits.description: Required for professional tour guides operating in DC.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DLCP Tour Guide program.
permits.requirements: Application, knowledge requirements.

permits.name: Funeral Director License
permits.description: Required for funeral directors operating in DC.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DLCP.
permits.requirements: Education, examination, apprenticeship.

permits.name: Interior Design License
permits.description: Required for practicing commercial interior design in DC.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DLCP.
permits.requirements: NCIDQ certification, education, experience.

permits.name: Athlete Agent License
permits.description: Required for athlete agents representing athletes in DC.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DLCP Athlete Agent Program.
permits.requirements: Application, disclosure of background.

permits.name: Combat Sports License
permits.description: Required for combat sports promoters, fighters, referees, and other participants in DC.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DLCP Combat Sports program.
permits.requirements: Varies by role (promoter, fighter, referee, etc.).

permits.name: Health Professional License
permits.description: Required for physicians, nurses, dentists, pharmacists, psychologists, social workers, and other health professionals practicing in DC. Over 30 health profession categories.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DC Health Board of respective profession.
permits.requirements: Varies by profession: education, exam, supervised practice, background check.

permits.name: Dog License
permits.description: Required for all dogs in DC. Must be licensed within specified period after acquisition or moving to DC.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DC Health.
permits.requirements: Proof of rabies vaccination.

permits.name: Animal Hobby Permit
permits.description: Required for keeping certain animals as a hobby (e.g., chickens, bees) in residential areas.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DC Health.
permits.requirements: Property details, animal housing plan, neighbor notification may be required.

permits.name: Exotic Animal Permit
permits.description: Required for keeping exotic animals in DC. Many exotic species are prohibited.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DC Health.
permits.requirements: Species identification, housing plan, safety measures.

permits.name: Pigeon Coop Permit
permits.description: Required for keeping pigeons in DC.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DC Health.
permits.requirements: Coop specifications, location details.

permits.name: Animal Disease Prevention Permit
permits.description: Required for activities related to animal disease prevention and control in DC.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DC Health.
permits.requirements: Varies by activity.

permits.name: Residential Parking Permit (RPP)
permits.description: Allows DC residents to park in their designated Residential Permit Parking zone without time restrictions.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DC DMV online, by mail, or in person.
permits.requirements: DC vehicle registration, proof of residency in RPP zone.
permits.processing_time: Immediate at DMV; 7-10 days by mail

permits.name: Visitor Parking Permit
permits.description: Allows guests of DC residents to park in RPP zones. Limited number per household per year.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DC DMV.
permits.requirements: DC resident with valid RPP, guest vehicle information.

permits.name: Healthcare Provider Temporary Parking Permit
permits.description: Allows healthcare providers making house calls to park in RPP zones.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DC DMV.
permits.requirements: Healthcare provider credentials, proof of house call services.

permits.name: Contractual Employee Temporary Parking Permit
permits.description: Allows contractors working on a job in an RPP zone to park there temporarily.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DC DMV.
permits.requirements: Proof of contract work at address in RPP zone.

permits.name: Learner's Permit
permits.description: Required first step before obtaining a DC driver's license. Allows supervised driving.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply at DC DMV service center.
permits.requirements: Knowledge test, vision test, identity documents, Social Security number.

permits.name: Driver's License
permits.description: Standard DC driver's license for operating a motor vehicle.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply at DC DMV after holding learner's permit for required period.
permits.requirements: Learner's permit, road skills test, identity documents.

permits.name: Commercial Driver's License (CDL)
permits.description: Required for operating commercial vehicles (buses, trucks, hazmat) in DC.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply at DC DMV.
permits.requirements: CDL knowledge test, CDL skills test, medical certificate, background check (some endorsements).

permits.name: Trip Permit (Buses)
permits.description: Required for operating charter or commercial buses on DC roads for specific trips.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DC DMV.
permits.requirements: Vehicle information, trip details, insurance.

permits.name: Firearms Registration
permits.description: Required for all firearms possessed in DC. DC requires registration of every firearm.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through MPD Firearms Registration Section.
permits.requirements: Background check, firearms training, vision test, ballistics test for handguns.

permits.name: Marriage License
permits.description: Required to legally marry in DC. No waiting period, no blood test required.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply at DC Superior Court Marriage Bureau. Both parties must appear in person.
permits.requirements: Valid government-issued photo ID, Social Security numbers, $35 fee.

permits.name: Domestic Partnership Registration
permits.description: Register a domestic partnership in DC.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through Mayor's Office of LGBTQ Affairs.
permits.requirements: Both partners must appear, valid ID, meet DC requirements.

permits.name: Birth Certificate Request
permits.description: Request a certified copy of a DC birth certificate.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply online or in person through DC Health Vital Records Division.
permits.requirements: Valid ID, relationship to person on certificate.

permits.name: Death Certificate Request
permits.description: Request a certified copy of a DC death certificate.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DC Health Vital Records Division.
permits.requirements: Valid ID, relationship to decedent or legal authorization.

permits.name: Retail Food License
permits.description: Required for retail food establishments including grocery stores, convenience stores, and specialty food shops.
permits.how_to_apply: Apply through DLCP as part of BBL.
permits.requirements: Health inspection, food safety compliance, BBL.
